alert.note: Alert for Northeast Mountains; Okanogan Highlands; Spokane Area; Washington Palouse (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued November 30 at 4:10AM PST until December 02 at 4:00PM PST by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 4 AM FRIDAY TO 4 PM PST SATURDAY... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations between 2 and 6 inches. Locally up to 8 inches in the North Idaho Panhandle. Wind gusts as high as 40 mph Saturday. * WHERE...Portions of North and North Central Idaho and North Central, Northeast, and Southeast Washington. * WHEN...From 4 AM Friday to 4 PM PST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Winter driving conditions. The conditions could impact the Friday morning and evening commutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Light snow is expected tonight into Friday morning, which may result in slick driving conditions. Snow intensity will likely increase Friday afternoon into Saturday morning.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1. Be prepared for slippery roads. Slow down and use caution while driving. If you are going outside, watch your first few steps taken on stairs, sidewalks, and driveways. These surfaces could be icy and slippery, increasing your risk of a fall and injury.
